block.p: Donna Adeline Avedisian, the daughter of Dorothy Avedisian of Chicago and Armen G. Avedisian of Munster, Ind., was married yesterday to Craig Louis Chanti, a son of Gerri M. Chanti and Louis Chanti, both of Roebling, N.J. Archbishop Khajag Barsamian, the primate of the diocese of the Armenian Church of America, performed the ceremony at St. Vartan Armenian Cathedral in Manhattan.

Ms. Avedisian, 31, is keeping her name. She is an abstract painter and has a bachelor's degree from a joint program of Tufts University and the School of the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston. She received a Master of Fine Arts degree from the Rhode Island School of Design. Her father, who retired as the chief executive of Firstar Bank of Lake Geneva in Wisconsin, was in 1986-87 the chairman of the Statue of Liberty-Ellis Island Centennial Commission. Her mother, a lyric soprano, who sings in Chicago, was a founder and the artistic director of the Lake Geneva Floating Opera Festival.

He graduated from Drew University and was a noncommissioned officer in the Coast Guard from 1991 to 1995. He was a navigation instructor aboard the Eagle, the Coast Guard's training barque. His mother is the coordinator of volunteers for Capital Health Systems, a hospital network based in Trenton. His father retired as an operations officer for the Johnstone Psychiatric Training and Research Center, which was in Bordentown, N.J.
